title: Motorists to save £165m in crackdown on car finance kick-backs
text:
Drivers could pay less for their vehicles under plans set out today by the City watchdog to ban unfair commissions on car finance loans.

The Financial Conduct Authority's (FCA) announcement today follows damming research published in March revealing motorists are overcharged £300m a year through fees on these deals, which allow cars to be paid off in instalments. This means individual drivers can overpay by more than £1,000 each.

Car salesmen and brokers can be incentivised to charge drivers more, as the commission they get from lenders is often linked to the interest rate paid by the customer.
